front-matter-description.Layout_FrontMatterHeader: If set, this specifies the theme layout file to use. Use the layout file name without the file extension. e.g. 'Theme'
front-matter-description.Template_FrontMatterHeader: Name of liquid template in theme witch will be used for display this page by including  {{ page.content }} expression
front-matter-description.Permalink_FrontMatterHeader: Refer to the URLs (excluding the domain name or directory folder) for your pages, posts. Possible values :folder/:categories/:year/:month/:day/:title, my-page, :folder/my-page
front-matter-description.Published_FrontMatterHeader: Set to false if you don’t want a specific post to show up when the site is generated.
front-matter-description.Category_FrontMatterHeader: Instead of placing posts inside of folders, you can specify one or more categories that the post belongs to. When the site is generated the post will act as though it had been set with these categories normally. Categories (plural key) can be specified as a YAML list or a comma-separated string.
front-matter-description.Tags_FrontMatterHeader: Similar to categories, one or multiple tags can be added to a post. Also like categories, tags can be specified as a YAML list or a comma-separated string.
front-matter-description.Alias_FrontMatterHeader: It allows  to specify aliases on a per page basis, in the YAML front matter. This aliases can be used for redirection.
front-matter-description.Authorize_FrontMatterHeader: Set to true if you want to block anonymous access to the page.
